the TODOs to implement comprehensive tests \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                          WHAT IS A TEST FILE? \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 Think of a test file as a quality control inspector in a factory. Just like an inspector checks every product to make sure it works correctly before shipping, our test file checks every function in our smart contract to ensure it behaves exactly as expected. WHY DO WE TEST? 1. **Catch Bugs Before Deployment**: Once a contract is on the blockchain,    you CAN'T change it. A bug in production could mean lost funds forever.    Testing is your safety net. 2. **Document Expected Behavior**: Tests serve as living documentation.    Someone reading your tests can understand exactly what your contract    should do, with concrete examples. 3. **Prevent Regressions**: When you add new features, tests ensure you    didn't accidentally break existing functionality. 4. **Build Confidence**: Good tests let you refactor code fearlessly,    knowing you'll catch any mistakes immediately. \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                        FOUNDRY TESTING BASICS \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 Foundry's testing framework follows these conventions: - **Test functions MUST start with \"test\"**: This is how Foundry identifies   which functions to run. `testSetNumber()` runs, `checkNumber()` doesn't. - **setUp() runs before EACH test**: Think of it like resetting the game   board before each round. This ensures every test starts from the same   clean state (isolation!). - **Assertions verify behavior**:   - `assertEq(a, b)`: Check if two values are equal   - `assertTrue(x)`: Check if something is true   - `assertFalse(x)`: Check if something is false   - `vm.expectRevert()`: Check that the next call fails (reverts) - **Cheatcodes control the environment** (vm.*):   - `vm.prank(address)`: Next call pretends to come from that address   - `vm.deal(address, amount)`: Give an address some ETH   - `vm.expectEmit()`: Check that an event was emitted \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                      HOW TO RUN TESTS \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 forge test                    # Run all tests forge test -vvv               # Verbose mode - see detailed output forge test --gas-report       # Show gas costs for each function forge test --match-test testSetNumber  # Run only tests matching this name forge coverage                # See which lines of code are tested \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550                      THIS TEST FILE SHOULD COVER: \u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550\u2550 \u2713 Constructor behavior (initial state) \u2713 Value type operations (uint256, address, bool) \u2713 Mapping operations (set, get, check existence) \u2713 Array operations (push, access, length, remove) \u2713 Struct operations (create, read, update) \u2713 Data location behavior (storage vs memory vs calldata) \u2713 Event emissions (logging important state changes) \u2713 Edge cases (max values, empty arrays, zero address) \u2713 Gas measurements (comparing costs of different approaches) \u2713 Fuzz testing (randomized inputs to find unexpected bugs) \u2713 Invariant testing (properties that should ALWAYS be true)","kind":"dev","methods":{"invariant_ArrayLengthConsistent()":{"details":"Verify length is never negative (always >= 0)"},"invariant_OwnerNeverChanges()":{"details":"Function name starts with \"invariant_\" for Foundry to recognize it"},"setUp()":{"details":"Runs before each test function      Creates fresh contract instance for each test (isolation)"},"testFuzz_IncrementNumber(uint256)":{"details":"Use bound() to constrain _start to avoid overflow"},"testFuzz_SetBalance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Foundry will generate random address and balance"},"testFuzz_SetNumber(uint256)":{"details":"Foundry will generate random values for _number"},"test_AddNumber_IncreasesLength()":{"details":"Verify length increases with each addNumber() call"},"test_AddNumber_StoresCorrectValue()":{"details":"Add numbers and verify they're at the correct indices"},"test_Constructor_SetsIsActive()":{"details":"Use assertTrue to check that datatypes.isActive() returns true"},"test_Constructor_SetsOwner()":{"details":"Use assertEq to check that datatypes.owner() equals the owner variable"},"test_Deposit_IncreasesBalance()":{"details":"Use vm.deal() to give user1 ETH, then deposit"},"test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroAmount()":{"details":"Try to deposit 0 ETH, expect revert"},"test_EdgeCase_LargeArray()":{"details":"Add many elements and verify length"},"test_EdgeCase_MaxUint256()":{"details":"Set number to type(uint256).max and verify it works"},"test_EdgeCase_ZeroAddress()":{"details":"Set balance for address(0) and verify it works"},"test_Gas_ArrayOperations()":{"details":"Measure gas for adding numbers to array"},"test_Gas_SetNumber_Cold()":{"details":"Use gasleft() before and after to measure gas"},"test_Gas_SetNumber_Warm()":{"details":"First call warms storage, second call should be cheaper"},"test_GetBalance_ReturnsZeroForNewAddress()":{"details":"Mappings return default values (0 for uint256) for non-existent keys"},"test_GetFirstElement()":{"details":"Create memory array, call getFirstElement, verify result"},"test_GetFirstElement_RevertsOnEmpty()":{"details":"Create empty array, expect revert when getting first element"},"test_GetNumberAt_RevertsOnOutOfBounds()":{"details":"Add one number, try to access index 1, expect revert"},"test_GetNumber_ReturnsCorrectValue()":{"details":"Check initial state, then set and verify"},"test_GetNumbersLength_ReturnsCorrectLength()":{"details":"Add multiple numbers in a loop, verify length"},"test_GetUser_ReturnsDefaultForNonExistent()":{"details":"Get user data without registering, verify default values"},"test_HasBalance_ReturnsFalseForZero()":{"details":"Don't set balance, verify hasBalance returns false"},"test_HasBalance_ReturnsTrueForNonZero()":{"details":"Set a balance, verify hasBalance returns true"},"test_IncrementNumber()":{"details":"Set a number, increment it, verify it increased by 1"},"test_IncrementNumber_FromZero()":{"details":"Verify incrementing from 0 works correctly"},"test_IncrementNumber_RevertsOnOverflow()":{"details":"Set number to type(uint256).max, then try to increment      Use vm.expectRevert() before the call that should fail"},"test_RegisterUser()":{"details":"Register user, then get user data and verify all fields"},"test_RegisterUser_EmitsEvent()":{"details":"Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission"},"test_RegisterUser_UpdatesExistingUser()":{"details":"Register user twice with different balances, verify update"},"test_RemoveNumber()":{"details":"Add numbers, remove one, verify correct twice, verify second value overwrites first"},"test_SetMessage()":{"details":"Set message and verify it's stored correctly"},"test_SetNumber()":{"details":"Test the \"happy path\" - normal expected use case      Pattern: Arrange \u2192 Act \u2192 Assert"},"test_SetNumber_EmitsEvent()":{"details":"Use vm.expectEmit() to check event emissions      Parameters: vm.expectEmit(false, false, false, true)      Then emit the expected event, then call the function"},"test_SumMemoryArray()":{"details":"Create a memory array, sum it, verify result"},"test_SumMemoryArray_EmptyArray()":{"details":"Sum invariant_OwnerNeverChanges().details: Function name starts with "invariant_" for Foundry to recognize it

setUp().details: Runs before each test function      Creates fresh contract instance for each test (isolation)

testFuzz_IncrementNumber(uint256).details: Use bound() to constrain _start to avoid overflow

testFuzz_SetBalance(address,uint256).details: Foundry will generate random address and balance

testFuzz_SetNumber(uint256).details: Foundry will generate random values for _number

test_AddNumber_IncreasesLength().details: Verify length increases with each addNumber() call

test_AddNumber_StoresCorrectValue().details: Add numbers and verify they're at the correct indices

test_Constructor_SetsIsActive().details: Use assertTrue to check that datatypes.isActive() returns true

test_Constructor_SetsOwner().details: Use assertEq to check that datatypes.owner() equals the owner variable

test_Deposit_IncreasesBalance().details: Use vm.deal() to give user1 ETH, then deposit

test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroAmount().details: Try to deposit 0 ETH, expect revert

test_EdgeCase_LargeArray().details: Add many elements and verify length

test_EdgeCase_MaxUint256().details: Set number to type(uint256).max and verify it works

test_EdgeCase_ZeroAddress().details: Set balance for address(0) and verify it works

test_Gas_ArrayOperations().details: Measure gas for adding numbers to array

test_Gas_SetNumber_Cold().details: Use gasleft() before and after to measure gas

test_Gas_SetNumber_Warm().details: First call warms storage, second call should be cheaper

test_GetBalance_ReturnsZeroForNewAddress.details: Mappings return default values (0 for uint256) for non-existent keys

test_GetFirstElement().details: Create memory array, call getFirstElement, verify result

test_GetFirstElement_RevertsOnEmpty().details: Create empty array, expect revert when getting first element

test_GetNumberAt_RevertsOnOutOfBounds().details: Add one number, try to access index 1, expect revert

test_GetNumber_ReturnsCorrectValue().details: Check initial state, then set and verify

test_GetNumbersLength_ReturnsCorrectLeng.details: Add multiple numbers in a loop, verify length

test_GetUser_ReturnsDefaultForNonExisten.details: Get user data without registering, verify default values

test_HasBalance_ReturnsFalseForZero().details: Don't set balance, verify hasBalance returns false

test_HasBalance_ReturnsTrueForNonZero().details: Set a balance, verify hasBalance returns true

test_IncrementNumber().details: Set a number, increment it, verify it increased by 1

test_IncrementNumber_RevertsOnOverflow().details: Set number to type(uint256).max, then try to increment      Use vm.expectRevert() before the call that should fail

test_RegisterUser().details: Register user, then get user data and verify all fields

test_RegisterUser_EmitsEvent().details: Use vm.expectEmit() to verify event emission

test_RegisterUser_UpdatesExistingUser().details: Register user twice with different balances, verify update

test_RemoveNumber().details: Add numbers, remove one, verify correct removal

test_RemoveNumber_RevertsOnOutOfBounds().details: Add one number, try to remove at invalid index

test_SetBalance().details: Basic "write then read" pattern for mappings

test_SetBalance_IndependentAddresses().details: Set different balances for user1 and user2, verify both are correct

test_SetBalance_UpdatesExistingBalance().details: Set balance twice, verify second value overwrites first

test_SetMessage().details: Set message and verify it's stored correctly

test_SetNumber().details: Test the "happy path" - normal expected use case      Pattern: Arrange  Act  Assert

test_SetNumber_EmitsEvent().details: Use vm.expectEmit() to check event emissions      Parameters: vm.expectEmit(false, false, false, true)      Then emit the expected event, then call the function

test_SumMemoryArray().details: Create a memory array, sum it, verify result

test_SumMemoryArray_EmptyArray().details: Sum empty array, verify result is 0

test_SumMemoryArray_SingleElement().details: Sum array with one element, verify result

invariant_ArrayLengthConsistent().notice: Invariant: Array length should always be consistent

setUp().notice: setUp() FUNCTION  This special function runs BEFORE EACH AND EVERY test function. WHY? Isolation! We want each test to start from a clean slate, like resetting a video game before each level. If Test A modifies the contract and Test B depends on that modification, our tests become fragile and hard to debug. WHAT HAPPENS HERE: 1. We create test addresses (owner, user1, user2) 2. We deploy a FRESH instance of DatatypesStorageSolution 3. We label addresses for better debugging output IMPORTANT: Even if Test A sets number = 100, when Test B runs, setUp() will deploy a brand new contract where number = 0 again. This is GOOD - it prevents tests from interfering with each other!

testFuzz_IncrementNumber(uint256).notice: Fuzz test for incrementNumber with bounded inputs

testFuzz_SetBalance(address,uint256).notice: Fuzz test for setBalance - tests with random addresses and values

testFuzz_SetNumber(uint256).notice: Fuzz test for setNumber - tests with random uint256 values

test_AddNumber_IncreasesLength().notice: Tests that adding numbers increases array length

test_AddNumber_StoresCorrectValue().notice: Tests that added numbers are stored correctly

test_Constructor_SetsIsActive().notice: Tests that the constructor correctly sets isActive to true

test_Constructor_SetsOwner().notice: Tests that the constructor correctly sets the owner

test_Deposit_RevertsOnZeroAmount().notice: Tests that deposit reverts on zero amount

test_EdgeCase_MaxUint256().notice: Tests handling of maximum uint256 value

test_Gas_ArrayOperations().notice: Benchmark gas cost of array operations

test_Gas_SetNumber_Cold().notice: Benchmark gas cost of setting a number (first time - cold storage)

test_Gas_SetNumber_Warm().notice: Benchmark gas cost of setting a number (second time - warm storage)

test_GetBalance_ReturnsZeroForNewAddress.notice: Tests that getBalance returns zero for new addresses

test_GetFirstElement().notice: Tests getting first element from calldata array

test_GetFirstElement_RevertsOnEmpty().notice: Tests that getFirstElement reverts on empty array

test_GetNumberAt_RevertsOnOutOfBounds().notice: Tests that getNumberAt reverts on out of bounds access

test_GetNumber_ReturnsCorrectValue().notice: Tests that getNumber returns the correct initial value

test_GetNumbersLength_ReturnsCorrectLeng.notice: Tests that getNumbersLength returns correct length

test_GetUser_ReturnsDefaultForNonExisten.notice: Tests that getUser returns default values for non-existent users

test_HasBalance_ReturnsFalseForZero().notice: Tests hasBalance returns false for zero balance

test_HasBalance_ReturnsTrueForNonZero().notice: Tests hasBalance returns true for non-zero balance

test_IncrementNumber_RevertsOnOverflow().notice: Tests that incrementNumber reverts when it would overflow

test_RegisterUser_EmitsEvent().notice: Tests that registerUser emits the correct event

test_RemoveNumber().notice: Tests removing a number from array

test_RemoveNumber_RevertsOnOutOfBounds().notice: Tests that removeNumber reverts on out of bounds

test_SetBalance().notice: Tests setting a balance for an address

test_SetBalance_IndependentAddresses().notice: Tests that balances are independent for different addresses

test_SetNumber_EmitsEvent().notice: Tests that setNumber emits the correct event

test_SumMemoryArray_SingleElement().notice: Tests summing a single element array
